Class ErrorEditText

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.support.v4.view.TintableBackgroundView, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewTreeObserver.OnPreDrawListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CvvEditText, ExpirationDateEditText

    public class ErrorEditText
extends android.support.design.widget.TextInputEditText
    Parent EditText for storing and displaying error states.

        Sets the hint on the TextInputLayout if this view is a child of a TextInputLayout, otherwise sets the hint on this EditText.
        Parameters:
        hint - The string resource to use as the hint.

      • setFieldHint

        public void setFieldHint(java.lang.String hint)
        Sets the hint on the TextInputLayout if this view is a child of a TextInputLayout, otherwise sets the hint on this EditText.
        Parameters:
        hint - The string value to use as the hint.

      • focusNextView

        public android.view.View focusNextView()
        Request focus for the next view.
        Returns:
        the view

      • setOptional

        public void setOptional(boolean optional)
        Set this ErrorEditText as optional. Optional fields are always valid and show no error message.
        Parameters:
        optional - true to set this ErrorEditText to optional, false to set it to required.

      • isOptional

        public boolean isOptional()
        Is optional boolean.
        Returns:
        If this ErrorEditText is optional or not. See setOptional(boolean).

      • isError

        public boolean isError()
        Is error boolean.
        Returns:
        the current error state of the EditText

      • setError

        public void setError(@Nullable
                     java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Controls the error state of this ErrorEditText and sets a visual indication that the ErrorEditText contains an error.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - the error message to display to the user. null will remove any error message displayed.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Override this method validation logic
        Returns:
        true

      • getErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
        Override this method to display error messages
        Returns:
        String error message to display.

      • validate

        public void validate()
        Check if the ErrorEditText is valid and set the correct error state and visual indication on it.

      • closeSoftKeyboard

        public void closeSoftKeyboard()
        Attempt to close the soft keyboard. Will have no effect if the keyboard is not open.
